info.title: ContainerServiceFleetClient
info.description: Azure Kubernetes Fleet Manager api client.

get.description: List the operations for the provider
Lists fleets in the specified subscription.
Lists fleets in the specified subscription and resource group.

APIServerAccessProfile.description: Access profile for the Fleet hub API server.

enablePrivateCluster.description: Whether to create the Fleet hub as a private cluster or not.

enableVnetIntegration.description: Whether to enable apiserver vnet integration for the Fleet hub or not.

subnetId.description: The subnet to be used when apiserver vnet integration is enabled. It is required when creating a new Fleet with BYO vnet.

AdoptionPolicy.description: Action if the Namespace with the same name already exists.

values.name: Never
values.description: If the Namespace already exists, do not take over the existing Namespace to be managed by ARM.

values.name: IfIdentical
values.description: If there is an identical Namespace, take over the existing Namespace to be managed by ARM.

values.name: Always
values.description: Always take over the existing Namespace to be managed by ARM, even if it is not identical.

AgentProfile.description: Agent profile for the Fleet hub.

subnetId.description: The ID of the subnet which the Fleet hub node will join on startup. If this is not specified, a vnet and subnet will be generated and used.

vmSize.description: The virtual machine size of the Fleet hub.

AutoUpgradeLastTriggerStatus.description: AutoUpgradeLastTriggerStatus is the status of the last AutoUpgrade trigger (attempt to automatically create and start UpdateRun when there are new released versions) of an auto upgrade profile.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: The last AutoUpgrade trigger was succeeded.

values.name: Failed
values.description: The last AutoUpgrade trigger failed.

AutoUpgradeNodeImageSelection.description: The node image upgrade to be applied to the target clusters in auto upgrade.

values.name: Latest
values.description: Use the latest image version when upgrading nodes. Clusters may use different image versions (e.g., 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.12' and 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.19') because, for example, the latest available version is different in different regions.

values.name: Consistent
values.description: The image versions to upgrade nodes to are selected as described below: for each node pool in managed clusters affected by the update run, the system selects the latest image version such that it is available across all other node pools (in all other clusters) of the same image type. As a result, all node pools of the same image type will be upgraded to the same image version. For example, if the latest image version for image type 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd' is 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.12' for a node pool in cluster A in region X, and is 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.17' for a node pool in cluster B in region Y, the system will upgrade both node pools to image version 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.12'.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

eTag.description: If eTag is provided in the response body, it may also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

AutoUpgradeProfileId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

AutoUpgradeProfileListResult.description: The response of a AutoUpgradeProfile list operation.

value.description: The AutoUpgradeProfile items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the AutoUpgradeProfile resource.

updateStrategyId.description: The resource id of the UpdateStrategy resource to reference. If not specified, the auto upgrade will run on all clusters which are members of the fleet.

channel.description: Configures how auto-upgrade will be run.

nodeImageSelection.description: The node image upgrade to be applied to the target clusters in auto upgrade.

disabled.description:
If set to False: the auto upgrade has effect - target managed clusters will be upgraded on schedule.
If set to True: the auto upgrade has no effect - no upgrade will be run on the target managed clusters.
This is a boolean and not an enum because enabled/disabled are all available states of the auto upgrade profile.
By default, this is set to False.

autoUpgradeProfileStatus.description: The status of the auto upgrade profile.

targetKubernetesVersion.description:
This is the target Kubernetes version for auto-upgrade. The format must be `{major version}.{minor version}`. For example, "1.30".
  By default, this is empty.
  If upgrade channel is set to TargetKubernetesVersion, this field must not be empty.
  If upgrade channel is Rapid, Stable or NodeImage, this field must be empty.

longTermSupport.description:
If upgrade channel is not TargetKubernetesVersion, this field must be False.
  If set to True: Fleet auto upgrade will continue generate update runs for patches of minor versions earlier than N-2 
  (where N is the latest supported minor version) if those minor versions support Long-Term Support (LTS).
  By default, this is set to False.
  For more information on AKS LTS, please see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/long-term-support

AutoUpgradeProfileProvisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the AutoUpgradeProfile resource.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: Resource has been created.

values.name: Failed
values.description: Resource creation failed.

values.name: Canceled
values.description: Resource creation was canceled.

AutoUpgradeProfileStatus.description: AutoUpgradeProfileStatus is the status of an auto upgrade profile.

lastTriggeredAt.description: The UTC time of the last attempt to automatically create and start an UpdateRun as triggered by the release of new versions.

lastTriggerStatus.description: The status of the last AutoUpgrade trigger.

lastTriggerError.description: The error details of the last trigger.

lastTriggerUpgradeVersions.description: The target Kubernetes version or node image versions of the last trigger.

ClusterResourceId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

values.name: NoSchedule
values.description: Do not allow new pods to schedule onto the node unless they tolerate the taint, but allow all pods submitted to Kubelet without going through the scheduler to start, and allow all already-running pods to continue running. Enforced by the scheduler.

Core.V1.TolerationOperator.description: A toleration operator is the set of operators that can be used in a toleration.

values.name: Exists
values.description: Toleration Operator Exists

values.name: Equal
values.description: Toleration Operator Equal

DeletePolicy.description: Delete options for the ARM managed namespace.

values.name: Keep
values.description: Delete the ARM resource but keep the Namespace.

values.name: Delete
values.description: Delete both ARM resource and Namespace.

fqdn.description: The FQDN of the Fleet hub.

GateConfiguration.description: GateConfiguration is used to define where Gates should be placed within the Update Run.

displayName.description: The human-readable display name of the Gate.

type.description: The type of the Gate determines how it is completed.

properties.description: Properties of a Gate that can be patched.

GatePatchProperties.description: Properties of a Gate that can be patched.

GateProperties.description: A Gate controls the progression during a staged rollout, e.g. in an Update Run.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the Gate resource.

displayName.description: The human-readable display name of the Gate.

gateType.description: The type of the Gate determines how it is completed.

target.description: The target that the Gate is controlling, e.g. an Update Run.

GateProvisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the Gate resource.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: Resource has been created.

values.name: Failed
values.description: Resource creation failed.

values.name: Canceled
values.description: Resource creation was canceled.

GateResourceId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

values.name: Pending
values.description: A Pending Gate will continue to block the staged rollout process it is controlling.

values.name: Skipped
values.description: A Skipped Gate means that the staged rollout process it is controlling was skipped.

values.name: Completed
values.description: An Completed Gate allows the staged rollout process to continue.

GateTarget.description: The target that the Gate is controlling, e.g. an Update Run. Exactly one of the properties objects will be set.

id.description: The resource id that the Gate is controlling the rollout of.

updateRunProperties.description: The properties of the Update Run that the Gate is targeting.

GateType.description: The type of the Gate determines how it is completed.

values.name: Approval
values.description: An approval gate is completed by setting its state to be Completed.

GenerateResponse.description: GenerateResponse is the response of a generate request.

id.description: The ARM resource id of the generated UpdateRun. e.g.: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ContainerService/fleets/{fleetName}/updateRuns/{updateRunName}'.

ManagedClusterUpdate.description: The update to be applied to the ManagedClusters.

upgrade.description: The upgrade to apply to the ManagedClusters.

nodeImageSelection.description: The node image upgrade to be applied to the target nodes in update run.

ManagedClusterUpgradeSpec.description: The upgrade to apply to a ManagedCluster.

type.description: ManagedClusterUpgradeType is the type of upgrade to be applied.

kubernetesVersion.description: The Kubernetes version to upgrade the member clusters to.

ManagedClusterUpgradeType.description: The type of upgrade to perform when targeting ManagedClusters.

values.name: Full
values.description: Full upgrades the control plane and all agent pools of the target ManagedClusters. Requires the ManagedClusterUpgradeSpec.KubernetesVersion property to be set.

values.name: NodeImageOnly
values.description: NodeImageOnly upgrades only the node images of the target ManagedClusters. Requires the ManagedClusterUpgradeSpec.KubernetesVersion property to NOT be set.

values.name: ControlPlaneOnly
values.description: ControlPlaneOnly upgrades only targets the KubernetesVersion of the ManagedClusters and will not be applied to the AgentPool. Requires the ManagedClusterUpgradeSpec.KubernetesVersion property to be set.

ManagedNamespaceProperties.description: The namespace properties for the fleet managed namespace.

labels.description: The labels for the fleet managed namespace.

annotations.description: The annotations for the fleet managed namespace.

defaultResourceQuota.description: The default resource quota for the fleet managed namespace.

defaultNetworkPolicy.description: The default network policy for the fleet managed namespace.

MemberUpdateStatus.description: The status of a member update operation.

status.description: The status of the MemberUpdate operation.

clusterResourceId.description: The Azure resource id of the target Kubernetes cluster.

operationId.description: The operation resource id of the latest attempt to perform the operation.

message.description: The status message after processing the member update operation.

Meta.V1.LabelSelector.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

Meta.V1.LabelSelectorOperator.description: A label selector operator is the set of operators that can be used in a selector requirement.

values.name: In
values.description: Label Selector Operator In

values.name: NotIn
values.description: Label Selector Operator NotIn

values.name: Exists
values.description: Label Selector Operator Exists

values.name: DoesNotExist
values.description: Label Selector Operator DoesNotExist

Meta.V1.LabelSelectorRequirement.description: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

NetworkPolicy.description: The network policy for the managed namespace.

ingress.description: The ingress policy for the managed namespace.

egress.description: The egress policy for the managed namespace.

NodeImageSelection.description: The node image upgrade to be applied to the target nodes in update run.

customNodeImageVersions.description: Custom node image versions to upgrade the nodes to. This field is required if node image selection type is Custom. Otherwise, it must be empty. For each node image family (e.g., 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd'), this field can contain at most one version (e.g., only one of 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2023.01.12' or 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2023.02.12', not both). If the nodes belong to a family without a matching image version in this field, they are not upgraded.

NodeImageSelectionStatus.description: The node image upgrade specs for the update run.

selectedNodeImageVersions.description: The image versions to upgrade the nodes to.

values.name: Latest
values.description: Use the latest image version when upgrading nodes. Clusters may use different image versions (e.g., 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.12' and 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.19') because, for example, the latest available version is different in different regions.

values.name: Consistent
values.description: The image versions to upgrade nodes to are selected as described below: for each node pool in managed clusters affected by the update run, the system selects the latest image version such that it is available across all other node pools (in all other clusters) of the same image type. As a result, all node pools of the same image type will be upgraded to the same image version. For example, if the latest image version for image type 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd' is 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.12' for a node pool in cluster A in region X, and is 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.17' for a node pool in cluster B in region Y, the system will upgrade both node pools to image version 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2021.10.12'.

values.name: Custom
values.description: Upgrade the nodes to the custom image versions. When set, update run will use node image versions provided in customNodeImageVersions to upgrade the nodes. If set, customNodeImageVersions must not be empty.

version.description: The image version to upgrade the nodes to (e.g., 'AKSUbuntu-1804gen2containerd-2022.12.13').

Placement.V1.Affinity.description: Affinity is a group of cluster affinity scheduling rules. More to be added.

clusterAffinity.description: ClusterAffinity contains cluster affinity scheduling rules for the selected resources.

Placement.V1.ClusterAffinity.description: ClusterAffinity contains cluster affinity scheduling rules for the selected resources.

requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExe.description: If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the resource will not be scheduled onto the cluster. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point after the placement (e.g. due to an update), the system may or may not try to eventually remove the resource from the cluster.

Placement.V1.ClusterResourcePlacementSpe.description: ClusterResourcePlacementSpec defines the desired state of ClusterResourcePlacement.

policy.description: Policy defines how to select member clusters to place the selected resources. If unspecified, all the joined member clusters are selected.

clusterSelectorTerms.description: ClusterSelectorTerms is a list of cluster selector terms. The terms are `ORed`.

labelSelector.description: LabelSelector is a label query over all the joined member clusters. Clusters matching the query are selected. If you specify both label and property selectors in the same term, the results are AND'd.

propertySelector.description: PropertySelector is a property query over all joined member clusters. Clusters matching the query are selected. If you specify both label and property selectors in the same term, the results are AND'd. At this moment, PropertySelector can only be used with `RequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution` affinity terms. This field is beta-level; it is for the property-based scheduling feature and is only functional when a property provider is enabled in the deployment.

Placement.V1.PlacementPolicy.description: PlacementPolicy contains the rules to select target member clusters to place the selected resources. Note that only clusters that are both joined and satisfying the rules will be selected. You can only specify at most one of the two fields: ClusterNames and Affinity. If none is specified, all the joined clusters are selected.

placementType.description: Type of placement. Can be "PickAll", "PickN" or "PickFixed". Default is PickAll.

clusterNames.description: ClusterNames contains a list of names of MemberCluster to place the selected resources. Only valid if the placement type is "PickFixed"

affinity.description: Affinity contains cluster affinity scheduling rules. Defines which member clusters to place the selected resources. Only valid if the placement type is "PickAll" or "PickN".

tolerations.description: If specified, the ClusterResourcePlacement's Tolerations. Tolerations cannot be updated or deleted. This field is beta-level and is for the taints and tolerations feature.

Placement.V1.PlacementType.description: PlacementType identifies the type of placement.

values.name: PickAll
values.description: PickAll picks all clusters that satisfy the rules.

values.name: PickFixed
values.description: PickFixed picks a fixed set of clusters.

Placement.V1.PropertySelector.description: PropertySelector helps user specify property requirements when picking clusters for resource placement.

matchExpressions.description: MatchExpressions is an array of PropertySelectorRequirements. The requirements are AND'd.

Placement.V1.PropertySelectorOperator.description: PropertySelectorOperator is the operator that can be used with PropertySelectorRequirements.

values.name: Gt
values.description: Gt dictates Fleet to select cluster if its observed value of a given property is greater than the value specified in the requirement.

values.name: Ge
values.description: Ge dictates Fleet to select cluster if its observed value of a given property is greater than or equal to the value specified in the requirement.

values.name: Eq
values.description: Eq dictates Fleet to select cluster if its observed value of a given property is equal to the values specified in the requirement.

values.name: Ne
values.description: Ne dictates Fleet to select cluster if its observed value of a given property is not equal to the values specified in the requirement.

values.name: Lt
values.description: Lt dictates Fleet to select cluster if its observed value of a given property is less than the value specified in the requirement.

values.name: Le
values.description: Le dictates Fleet to select cluster if its observed value of a given property is less than or equal to the value specified in the requirement.

Placement.V1.PropertySelectorRequirement.description: PropertySelectorRequirement is a specific property requirement when picking clusters for resource placement.

name.description: Name is the name of the property; it should be a Kubernetes label name.

operator.description: Operator specifies the relationship between a cluster's observed value of the specified property and the values given in the requirement.

values.description: Values are a list of values of the specified property which Fleet will compare against the observed values of individual member clusters in accordance with the given operator. At this moment, each value should be a Kubernetes quantity. For more information, see https://pkg.go.dev/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/api/resource#Quantity. If the operator is Gt (greater than), Ge (greater than or equal to), Lt (less than), or `Le` (less than or equal to), Eq (equal to), or Ne (ne), exactly one value must be specified in the list.

Placement.V1.Toleration.description: Toleration allows ClusterResourcePlacement to tolerate any taint that matches the triple <key,value,effect> using the matching operator <operator>.

key.description: Key is the taint key that the toleration applies to. Empty means match all taint keys. If the key is empty, operator must be Exists; this combination means to match all values and all keys.

operator.description: Operator represents a key's relationship to the value. Valid operators are Exists and Equal. Defaults to Equal. Exists is equivalent to wildcard for value, so that a ClusterResourcePlacement can tolerate all taints of a particular category.

value.description: Value is the taint value the toleration matches to. If the operator is Exists, the value should be empty, otherwise just a regular string.

effect.description: Effect indicates the taint effect to match. Empty means match all taint effects. When specified, only allowed value is NoSchedule.

PlacementProfile.description: The configuration profile for default ClusterResourcePlacement for placement.

PolicyRule.description: The possible values representing different network policy rules.

values.name: AllowAll
values.description: Allow all network traffic.

values.name: DenyAll
values.description: Deny all network traffic.

values.name: AllowSameNamespace
values.description: Allow traffic within the same namespace.

PropagationPolicy.description: The propagation to be used for provisioning the namespace among the fleet.

type.description: The type of the policy to be used. Default is Placement.

placementProfile.description: The profile to be used for propagation via placement.

PropagationType.description: How the namespace will be provisioned among the fleet members.

values.name: Placement
values.description: Using ClusterResourcePlacement.

ResourceQuota.description: The resource quota for the managed namespace.

cpuRequest.description: The CPU request for the managed namespace. See more at https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#meaning-of-cpu

cpuLimit.description: The CPU limit for the managed namespace. See more at https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#meaning-of-cpu

memoryRequest.description: The memory request for the managed namespace. See more at https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#meaning-of-memory

memoryLimit.description: The memory limit for the managed namespace. See more at https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#meaning-of-memory

SkipProperties.description: The properties of a skip operation containing multiple skip requests.

SkipTarget.description: The definition of a single skip request.

SubnetResourceId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

TargetType.description: The target type of a skip request.

values.name: Member
values.description: Skip the update of a member.

values.name: Group
values.description: Skip the update of a group.

values.name: Stage
values.description: Skip the update of an entire stage including the after stage wait.

values.name: AfterStageWait
values.description: Skip the update of the after stage wait of a certain stage.

Timing.description: Whether the Gate is placed before or after the target.

values.name: Before
values.description: The Gate is before the target.

values.name: After
values.description: The Gate is after the target.

name.description:
Name of the group.
It must match a group name of an existing fleet member.

beforeGates.description: A list of Gates that will be created before this Group is executed.

afterGates.description: A list of Gates that will be created after this Group is executed.

members.description: The list of member this UpdateGroup updates.

beforeGates.description: The list of Gates that will run before this UpdateGroup.

afterGates.description: The list of Gates that will run after this UpdateGroup.

UpdateRun.description: A multi-stage process to perform update operations across members of a Fleet.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

eTag.description: If eTag is provided in the response body, it may also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

UpdateRunGateStatus.description: The status of the Gate, as represented in the Update Run.

displayName.description: The human-readable display name of the Gate.

gateId.description: The resource id of the Gate.

UpdateRunGateTargetProperties.description: The properties of the Update Run that the Gate is targeting.

name.description: The name of the Update Run.

stage.description: The Update Stage of the Update Run.

group.description: The Update Group of the Update Run.

timing.description: Whether the Gate is placed before or after the update itself.

UpdateRunListResult.description: The response of a UpdateRun list operation.

value.description: The UpdateRun items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the UpdateRun resource.

updateStrategyId.description:
The resource id of the FleetUpdateStrategy resource to reference.

When creating a new run, there are three ways to define a strategy for the run:
1. Define a new strategy in place: Set the "strategy" field.
2. Use an existing strategy: Set the "updateStrategyId" field. (since 2023-08-15-preview)
3. Use the default strategy to update all the members one by one: Leave both "updateStrategyId" and "strategy" unset. (since 2023-08-15-preview)

Setting both "updateStrategyId" and "strategy" is invalid.

UpdateRuns created by "updateStrategyId" snapshot the referenced UpdateStrategy at the time of creation and store it in the "strategy" field. 
Subsequent changes to the referenced FleetUpdateStrategy resource do not propagate.
UpdateRunStrategy changes can be made directly on the "strategy" field before launching the UpdateRun.

strategy.description:
The strategy defines the order in which the clusters will be updated.
If not set, all members will be updated sequentially. The UpdateRun status will show a single UpdateStage and a single UpdateGroup targeting all members.
The strategy of the UpdateRun can be modified until the run is started.

managedClusterUpdate.description: The update to be applied to all clusters in the UpdateRun. The managedClusterUpdate can be modified until the run is started.

autoUpgradeProfileId.description: AutoUpgradeProfileId is the id of an auto upgrade profile resource.

UpdateRunProvisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the UpdateRun resource.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: Resource has been created.

values.name: Failed
values.description: Resource creation failed.

values.name: Canceled
values.description: Resource creation was canceled.

UpdateRunResourceId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

stages.description: The stages composing an update run. Stages are run sequentially withing an UpdateRun.

nodeImageSelection.description: The node image upgrade specs for the update run. It is only set in update run when `NodeImageSelection.type` is `Consistent`.

UpdateRunStrategy.description:
Defines the update sequence of the clusters via stages and groups.

Stages within a run are executed sequentially one after another.
Groups within a stage are executed in parallel.
Member clusters within a group are updated sequentially one after another.

A valid strategy contains no duplicate groups within or across stages.

stages.description: The list of stages that compose this update run. Min size: 1.

UpdateStage.description: Defines a stage which contains the groups to update and the steps to take (e.g., wait for a time period) before starting the next stage.

name.description: The name of the stage. Must be unique within the UpdateRun.

groups.description: Defines the groups to be executed in parallel in this stage. Duplicate groups are not allowed. Min size: 1.

afterStageWaitInSeconds.description: The time in seconds to wait at the end of this stage before starting the next one. Defaults to 0 seconds if unspecified.

beforeGates.description: A list of Gates that will be created before this Stage is executed.

afterGates.description: A list of Gates that will be created after this Stage is executed.

groups.description: The list of groups to be updated as part of this UpdateStage.

beforeGates.description: The list of Gates that will run before this UpdateStage.

afterGates.description: The list of Gates that will run after this UpdateStage.

afterStageWaitStatus.description: The status of the wait period configured on the UpdateStage.

UpdateState.description: The state of the UpdateRun, UpdateStage, UpdateGroup, or MemberUpdate.

values.name: NotStarted
values.description: The state of an UpdateRun/UpdateStage/UpdateGroup/MemberUpdate that has not been started.

values.name: Running
values.description: The state of an UpdateRun/UpdateStage/UpdateGroup/MemberUpdate that is running.

values.name: Stopping
values.description: The state of an UpdateRun/UpdateStage/UpdateGroup/MemberUpdate that is being stopped.

values.name: Stopped
values.description: The state of an UpdateRun/UpdateStage/UpdateGroup/MemberUpdate that has stopped.

values.name: Skipped
values.description: The state of an UpdateRun/UpdateStage/UpdateGroup/MemberUpdate that has been skipped.

values.name: Failed
values.description: The state of an UpdateRun/UpdateStage/UpdateGroup/MemberUpdate that has failed.

values.name: Pending
values.description: The state of an UpdateRun/UpdateStage/UpdateGroup/MemberUpdate that is pending.

values.name: Completed
values.description: The state of an UpdateRun/UpdateStage/UpdateGroup/MemberUpdate that has completed.

UpdateStatus.description: The status for an operation or group of operations.

startTime.description: The time the operation or group was started.

completedTime.description: The time the operation or group was completed.

state.description: The State of the operation or group.

error.description: The error details when a failure is encountered.

UpgradeChannel.description: Configuration of how auto upgrade will be run.

values.name: Stable
values.description:
Upgrades the clusters kubernetes version to the latest supported patch release on minor version N-1, where N is the latest supported minor version.
 For example, if a cluster runs version 1.17.7 and versions 1.17.9, 1.18.4, 1.18.6, and 1.19.1 are available, the cluster upgrades to 1.18.6.

values.name: Rapid
values.description: Upgrades the clusters kubernetes version to the latest supported patch release on the latest supported minor version.

values.name: NodeImage
values.description: Upgrade node image version of the clusters.

values.name: TargetKubernetesVersion
values.description:
Upgrades the clusters Kubernetes version to the latest supported patch version of the specified target Kubernetes version.
  For information on the behavior of update run for Kubernetes version upgrade, 
  see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/kubernetes-fleet/update-orchestration?tabs=azure-portal

WaitStatus.description: The status of the wait duration.

status.description: The status of the wait duration.

waitDurationInSeconds.description: The wait duration configured in seconds.

FilterQueryParameter.name: $filter
FilterQueryParameter.description: Filter the result list using the given expression.

SkipTokenQueryParameter.name: $skipToken
SkipTokenQueryParameter.description: The page-continuation token to use with a paged version of this API.

TopQueryParameter.name: $top
TopQueryParameter.description: The number of result items to return.
